CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 28, 1959, page A1, reads: "Congratulations! - Following swearing in ceremonies in the chambers of President Judge William McNauge... Board of Common Pleas Judges, last Friday morning. Atty. Richard F. Jones receives congratulations from his family, law partners and friends, upon becoming a member of the Pittsburgh Board of Public Education. Left to right: Atty. Wendell G. Freeland, Judge Homer S. Brown of Common Pleas Court and former law partner of Attorney Jones; the new school board member, Mrs. Jones, his wife, and Mrs. Robert L. Vann, president-treasurer of The Courier. Back row: Atty. Thomas Harper, Atty. Henry R. Smith Jr., Mrs. Donald E. Scott, Attorney Jones' daughter; Donald Jefferson, assistant deputy treasurer, Allegheny County, and Frank E. Bolden, city editor of The Courier. Attorneys Freeland, Smith, and Harper are Attorney Jones' law partners. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Atty. Wendell G. Freeland, Common Pleas Court Judge Homer S. Brown shaking hands with Pittsburgh Board of Public Education member Atty. Richard F. Jones, Eleanor Jones, President-treasurer of Pittsburgh Courier Jessie Vann; back row: Atty. Thomas Harper; Atty. Henry R. Smith Jr., Mrs. Donald E. Scott, Assistant deputy treasurer of Allegheny County Donald Jefferson, and city editor of Courier Frank E. Bolden, standing in law office
